definitions.definition: The measurement of the concentration of a solution , suspension or dispersion based upon its light-scattering properties.
A technique used to determine the levels of antibodies or antigens in a suspension, based on its light-scattering properties.

main_definition: ( analytical chemistry ) The measurement of the concentration of a solution , suspension or dispersion based upon its light-scattering properties.
secondary_definitions: ( immunology ) A technique used to determine the levels of antibodies or antigens in a suspension, based on its light-scattering properties.
